      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getNewPasswordResetForm(org.springframework.ui.Model model, java.lang.Long resetPasswordEntityId, java.lang.String resetKey)
      When a user clicks on the link in his/her email, this method is called This loads the resetPasswordEntity by the id passed in the url parameter, and loads it to the model and returns the newPassword.jsp that prompts user to enter new password, confirm and submit
      java.lang.String getResetPasswordForm(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      When user clicks on forgot password link, this controller is called this redirects to the resetPasswordRequest.jsp page, where user enters his/her email address
      java.lang.String postNewPasswordResetForm(org.springframework.ui.Model model, java.lang.Long resetPasswordEntityId, ResetPasswordEntity origResetPasswordEntity, org.springframework.validation.BindingResult result)
      When a user enters a password and submits the form.

      When user enter his/her email address on the resetPasswordRequest.jsp page and submit the form this method is called.

    • Method Detail

      • getResetPasswordForm

        @RequestMapping(value="/resetPasswordRequest",
                method=GET)
public java.lang.String getResetPasswordForm(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        When user clicks on forgot password link, this controller is called this redirects to the resetPasswordRequest.jsp page, where user enters his/her email address
        Parameters:
        model -
        Returns:

      • postResetPasswordForm

        @RequestMapping(value="/postResetPasswordForm",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String postResetPasswordForm(@ModelAttribute(value="resetPasswordEntity")
                                                    ResetPasswordEntity resetPasswordEntity,
                                                    org.springframework.validation.BindingResult result,
                                                    javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
        When user enter his/her email address on the resetPasswordRequest.jsp page and submit the form this method is called. this method passes the resetPasswordEntity that contains user email and the request url to the resetPasswordEntityService.saveResetPasswordEntityAndSendEmail() and returns the resetPasswordRequestResult.jsp page url eg. http://localhost:8080/prospectivestiles/getNewPasswordResetForm/7/16WSqXXMwxcRW0YXNDqAlg== req.getServerName() - localhost req.getServerPort() - 8080 req.getServletContext().getContextPath() - prospectivestiles I can't use req.getServletPath() coz it returns postResetPasswordForm i.e. the current request path. I will use "getNewPasswordResetForm/" coz that is the servletPath of the method that handles the link. Reference: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6814611/how-to-find-the-base-url-of-the-current-webapp-in-spring Check: http://forum.spring.io/forum/spring-projects/security/117238-secure-way-of-generate-new-users-reset-password
        Parameters:
        resetPasswordEntity -
        result -
        req -
        Returns:

      • getNewPasswordResetForm

        @RequestMapping(value="/getNewPasswordResetForm/{resetPasswordEntityId}/{resetKey}",
                method=GET)
public java.lang.String getNewPasswordResetForm(org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                                      @PathVariable(value="resetPasswordEntityId")
                                                      java.lang.Long resetPasswordEntityId,
                                                      @PathVariable(value="resetKey")
                                                      java.lang.String resetKey)
        When a user clicks on the link in his/her email, this method is called This loads the resetPasswordEntity by the id passed in the url parameter, and loads it to the model and returns the newPassword.jsp that prompts user to enter new password, confirm and submit
        Parameters:
        model -
        resetPasswordEntityId -
        resetKey -
        Returns:

      • postNewPasswordResetForm

        @RequestMapping(value="/postNewPasswordResetForm/{resetPasswordEntityId}",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String postNewPasswordResetForm(org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                                       @PathVariable(value="resetPasswordEntityId")
                                                       java.lang.Long resetPasswordEntityId,
                                                       @ModelAttribute
                                                       ResetPasswordEntity origResetPasswordEntity,
                                                       org.springframework.validation.BindingResult result)
        When a user enters a password and submits the form. this method is called. it saves the new password in the ResetPasswordEntity and updates the password field of the userEntity
        Parameters:
        resetPasswordEntity -
        result -
        Returns:
